name: BEST WESTERN PREMIER Cappello d'Oro

reviews.title: Beautiful Bergamo
reviews.text: This was our third stop during a 2 week driving holiday of Europe (first stop Troyes, France, then Weggis in Switzerland). Thank goodness for sat. nav., as after a long 5 hour journey and 33 degree heat, you can easily get lost trying to find the hotel. I agree with the comments before about the hotel car parking... the porter was supposed to be guiding my husband back into a miniature garage (and we have a small sports car) and through bad instructions managed to cause a scrape on the body of our car above the back wheel. I argued with the manager on this issue and he knocked off one night's parking fee (very generous!). They did move us to the secure parking area just four shops down from the hotel, so ask for this if you can as it's much easier and closer to the hotel.

We paid in advance for a deluxe king-size bedroom (their early bird offer) and got the room for £83 per night, incl. breakfast. The room was fairly large (on the 3rd floor) towards the back, so very quiet. We did see the building work, but no-one seemed to be working on it. Great big bathroom (with bath) and most important of all in the heat, good aircon. Breakfast was generous with hot and cold food - although why hotels can't offer breakfast up to 11am is a mystery!
reviews.title: Good but beware the building work

reviews.text: The funicular up to to the old town is a 10 min walk from the hotel and make sure to get the next funicular (a walk through the old town) which goes further up for absolutely stunning views and a lovely restaurant with balcony up there. The upper town is truly awe-inspiring.
reviews.title: Not for car travellers

reviews.text: We drove to Como one day and took the ferry around half the lake (a 2 hour fast service) and stopped for a while at Bellagio which was delightful - in fact we wish we had stayed one night there too. Unless you plan to tour a few of the lakes during your stay and use Bergamo as a base, it's probably sufficient to spend 2-3 nights in Bergamo to see all you want to see. Next stop, Romantic Road in Bavaria.
reviews.title: Fantastic City - good value hotel

reviews.text: This is a good hotel in a great location. It is conveniently located near to the train station, the furniculare to the old town and the downtown shopping centre. The hotel is very modern and clean and the staff are attentive.
reviews.title: Must go to Citta Alta

reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights at the start of a holiday through Italy, France and Switzerland. Rooms are very well kept and spotlessly clean. Bathrooms are modern and showers efficient. Breakfast is plentiful and of good quality. Overall, if you are staying in Bergamo, you can't go wrong staying here.
reviews.title: Good, well kept hotel.

reviews.text: We had a great stay at the Best Western Cappello D'Oro in Bergamo.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and quiet and the bathroom was modern. The breakfast was wonderful... a buffet with an amazing assortment of breads, pastries, fruit and hot dishes in silver chafing dishes. The breakfast room is very elegant. We also had dinner at the hotel restaurant one night and it was outstanding.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note that this is a modern hotel in the newer part of Bergamo, and is not a quaint old inn in the medieva hilltop part of Bergamo. However, it is only a 10 minute walk to the funicular that leads to the upper city. In addition, it is easily accessible, and has parking (although you have to pay for the parking). If you have a car, it is hard to find a place to stay in the upper city. If you want some modern comforts and conveniences, it is a great hotel.
reviews.title: Only one complaint

reviews.text: We stayed in November and had a free bottle of wine on arrival. Really nice room, marble floor and marble bathroom. The hotel has a very small lift and made for a very amusing trip up to the floor we were staying on as the bellman decided to get in with us and our cases - not recommended! For the price we paid to stay here we also booked a night's stay in milan but were sorely disappointed with the result and wished we had spent the whole trip in bergamo going up and down the funicolore to the old town. Beautiful place and cannot wait to return.
reviews.title: I loved this hotel (businesstourist from Norway)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi just a quick observation about this hotel. Its really central location and excellant staff who spoke English and where very helpful made our stay A1. They couldnt do enough for us. Got a fab room at the back with a balcony where the sun was shinning all day. Maybe not everyones choice but we found it exactly right for our needs will return in a few months. Loved Bergamo.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights from 2nd to 4th of February. We booked direct with Best Western and thought that the rate we got (95 euros per night with breakfast ) was very good considering that included single room occupation.
reviews.title: Great location
Fine Hotel
reviews.text: Hotel was so easy to get to from the airport by bus, second stop after the train station and the bus stopped opposite the hotel.

Our rooms were to the back of the hotel so were very quiet, not the biggest bedrooms or bathrooms in the world but very clean, warm and comforable - everything you need in my opinion.Maybe the walls were not the thickest and you could hear the shower in the next room etc - but hey that is why I travel with earplugs : )
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: The staff were friendly and a lightbulb was replaced in my bathroom very quickly after reporting it to them. Breakfast buffet was excellent with a wide choice.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

likes.disliked: — Couldn't work out the airconditioning unit

reviews.text: Stayed here with some business collegues for 2 nights. Sept.30 Oct.1. 2006. It was hot in Bergamo and all the air conditioning in the rooms were broke. Also this was the weekend so I assume they could find no one to fix it on the weekend, better they did not want to pay for it.
reviews.title: They do not care

aka: Best Western Premier Cappello d`Oro Hotel Bergamo
description: The BEST WESTERN PREMIER Hotel Cappello D'Oro is committed to combining the charm of traditional hospitality with modern comforts and efficiency, providing the ideal environment for cultural tourism and business requirements, in Bergamo city centre. The name and delicious dishes of its Del Moro Restaurant are renowned and are complemented by a hotel service that is in many respects unique in the city of Bergamo.The four-star accommodation delights guests with the quality of its rooms, the welcoming approach of its staff, the hotel's enviable position and catering that demonstrates why its cuisine has become so prestigious: from its sumptuous buffet breakfast to its tailor-made lunches and dinners.
